intro: Hoya lutea, commonly known as the golden hoya, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer or early autumn. Hoya lutea is a trailing plant that thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. It is relatively low-maintenance, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
